poem:
Freedom's Fabric

In threads of truth, they stitch the sky,  
Colorful squares whisper of struggle and defiance,  
Patches of love, woven with whispers of hope.  
Hands once silenced now thread resistance,  
On this vast quilt of identity, a community unfurls  
9,000 feet, each inch a verse—  
A tapestry of being, unyielding, unbound.
